    • Field Detail

      • tagSet

        private static final java.util.Set<Tag<?>> tagSet

      • HitTester

        public static final Tag<HitTester> HitTester
        Usually attached to widgets. Returns a HitTester object which allows to is visible at a specific location determine whether the widget

      • Shape

        public static final Tag<Shape> Shape
        Usually attached to widgets. Returns a Shape object which allows to draw the widget's shape and to determine whether a point lies within the its shape. However, a shape of a widget does not tell whether or not this widget is obscured by other widgets (use the HitTester Tag instead!)

      • Rendered

        public static final Tag<java.lang.Boolean> Rendered
        Usually attached to widgets. It tells whether this widget this widget is rendered. If so, it does not necessarily mean that it is also visible, since it could still be obfuscated by other controls.

      • Desc

        public static final Tag<java.lang.String> Desc
        A short human-readable descriptive text for a widget / action / or system

      • Enabled

        public static final Tag<java.lang.Boolean> Enabled
        determines whether a widget is enabled (e.g. in many GUI-Frameworks disabled items are greyed out)

      • IsRunning

        public static final Tag<java.lang.Boolean> IsRunning
        determines whether a system is running

      • Blocked

        public static final Tag<java.lang.Boolean> Blocked
        determines whether a widget is blocked by anything or whether it is accessible. For example: If there is a modal message box on the screen, this message box usually blocks other widgets which are consequently not clickable.

      • Foreground

        public static final Tag<java.lang.Boolean> Foreground
        determines whether a widget / system / window is in the foreground

      • Title

        public static final Tag<java.lang.String> Title
        the title of a widget (usually visible text, such as on a button)

      • ZIndex

        public static final Tag<java.lang.Double> ZIndex
        ZIndex of a widget (objects with higher values are drawn on top of objects with lower values)

      • Slider

        public static final Tag<Position[]> Slider
        Related to slides (from_Position -> to_Position)

      • NotResponding

        public static final Tag<java.lang.Boolean> NotResponding
        Usually attached to systems. Determines whether a system is non-responsive (hanging) This does not necessarily mean that the system crashed, it could just process certain tasks.

      • Role

        public static final Tag<Role> Role
        If attached to a widget, it indicates the Role of a widget, e.g. a 'Button' or a 'TextField'. If attached to an action, it indicates the Role of an action, e.g. a mouse action or a keyboard action, or a combination.

      • ToolTipText

        public static final Tag<java.lang.String> ToolTipText
        The value of the help text usually attached to many widgets (e.g. when you hover over an item and a little box with a description appears)

      • Modal

        public static final Tag<java.lang.Boolean> Modal
        Usually attached to window widgets. Determines whether the widget is modal (blocks other widgets)

      • Angle

        public static final Tag<java.lang.Double> Angle
        Usually attached to sliders or scrollbars. Determines the orientation (horizontal, vertical or an arbitrary angle)

      • KeyboardFocus

        public static final Tag<java.lang.Boolean> KeyboardFocus
        Whether a widget (e.g. a text box) has keyboard focus and will receive keyboard input

      • Text

        public static final Tag<java.lang.String> Text
        The text of a widget (e.g. the text within a text box)

      • WidgetMap

        public static final Tag<WidgetMap> WidgetMap

      • UID

        public static final Tag<UID> UID
        A unique identifier for a widget / actions / system

      • DynDesc

        public static final Tag<UnFunc<SUT,java.lang.String>> DynDesc

      • Visualizer

        public static final Tag<Visualizer> Visualizer
        A visualizer, which visualizes a widget or an action, so that one can get an idea of what the action will do when executed

      • Targets

        public static final Tag<java.util.List<Finder>> Targets
        Usually attached to actions, determines the widgets that this action will operate on

      • PID

        public static final Tag<java.lang.Long> PID
        The Process ID. Usually attached to systems.

      • TimeStamp

        public static final Tag<java.lang.Long> TimeStamp
        Refers to the time of an event. E.g.: If attached to an State it could refer to the time the state has been recorded. Likewise, if attached to an Action, it could refer to the point in time when the action has been executed.

      • ScreenshotPath

        public static final Tag<java.lang.String> ScreenshotPath
        Usually attached to an object of State. The value is a screenshot of the state.

      • OracleVerdict

        public static final Tag<Verdict> OracleVerdict
        Usually attached to a State object. The value is an outcome of a test oracle for that state. It is used to mark states as 'suspicious' or 'erroneous'

      • StandardMouse

        public static final Tag<Mouse> StandardMouse
        The standard mouse object. Usually attached to systems

      • StandardKeyboard

        public static final Tag<Keyboard> StandardKeyboard
        The standard keyboard object. Usually attached to systems

      • HasStandardMouse

        public static final Tag<java.lang.Boolean> HasStandardMouse
        Whether the system has a standard mouse. Usually attached to states.

      • HasStandardKeyboard

        public static final Tag<java.lang.Boolean> HasStandardKeyboard
        Whether the system has a standard keyboard. Usually attached to states.

      • StdOut

        public static final Tag<java.io.InputStream> StdOut

      • StdErr

        public static final Tag<java.io.InputStream> StdErr

      • StdIn

        public static final Tag<java.io.OutputStream> StdIn

      • SystemState

        public static final Tag<State> SystemState

      • ActionSet

        public static final Tag<java.util.Set<Action>> ActionSet

      • ExecutedAction

        public static final Tag<Action> ExecutedAction

      • ActionDuration

        public static final Tag<java.lang.Double> ActionDuration

      • ActionDelay

        public static final Tag<java.lang.Double> ActionDelay

      • ProcessHandles

        public static final Tag<java.util.Iterator<ProcessHandle>> ProcessHandles
        A list of process handles. Usually attached to a system. Process handles allow to obtain information about and stop the processes that they refer to.

      • RunningProcesses

        public static final Tag<java.util.List<Pair<java.lang.Long,java.lang.String>>> RunningProcesses
        A list of currently running processes and their names. Usually attached to a state.

      • SystemActivator

        public static final Tag<Proc> SystemActivator
        Usually attached to systems. A system activator can bring a system to the foreground. E.g.: If another process is currently in the foreground, the SystemActivator makes sure that the SUT gets focused again.
